intro: Ceropegia senegalensis, commonly known as the African violet or string of pearls, is a succulent plant native to Africa. It features fleshy, tuberous roots and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are often pink or purple in color. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick stems and roots. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Ceropegia senegalensis is popular as a houseplant due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
